title: can't pretty-print deneb blocks currently

labels.name: Epic Deneb
labels.description: Issues required to implement Deneb upgrade

body:
From Antithesis hackmd post:

https://hackmd.io/@opBRCgEeSP6XKr0nO99rbQ/Sy52r5Qrp#Teku

It'd be nice to build out support for deneb blocks to be pretty-printed.

The teku example above didnt seem to work with SignedBeaconBlock, SignedBlindedBeaconBlock

I added in a couple of containers but couldn't get things working, so raised a ticket so someone can extend pretty-print.

pretty-print works for Deneb blocks. Tried it locally.

```
teku debug-tools pretty-print deneb SignedBeaconBlock block.ssz
```

All of the supported types are under https://github.com/Consensys/teku/blob/master/teku/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/teku/cli/subcommand/debug/SszObjectType.java

If using hex can create file with an extension `.hex e.g. block.hex` with the hex contents and it should work.

Can use this issue to add Deneb types (like BlobSidecar, etc)
the hex on the page above didnt work, that's why i raised this ticket..
Yes i'm trying that and indeed fails.. looking at logs if the ssz was corrupted in some way
It sounds like this was ultimately data corruption on the hackmd, so that's good! Use the ticket for other changes if you want :)
well, I also tried taking it directly from Antithesis' log console. The same.

It seems that the remainder of the log message dropped down to the second log line. The report we created only showed the first log line and I didn't realize Java behaved in this manner. With the remainder of the block contents from the second line I managed to decode the block. I am still confused about the error message itself though.

This is the full error message:
